article_title: Survey: Support to renew AVFPD's funding high in Apple Valley
article_text:
. Named Measure G, that tax would've extended the current tax funding from Nov. 4, 2017 to June 30, 2034. Measure G needed a two-thirds majority vote to pass, but received just over 59 percent approval from about 9,000 voters served by the district.

With Measure G defeated and property tax revenue becoming a stagnant funding source that "isn't even enough to run a volunteer program," the extension of Measure V is a must for the district, according to Hultquist.

article_metadata.description: APPLE VALLEY — A recent survey found that concern over emergency response times is growing among town residents, signaling a push by the Apple Valley Fire Protection District’s Board of Directors to include a special tax measure on the November ballot to ensure the continuation of one of the district’s “critical funding sources,” according to Fire Chief Sid Hultquist.The survey — conducted by Fairbank Maslin Maullin Metz & Associates in conjunction
article_metadata.author: Matthew Cabe

twitter.title: Survey: Support to renew AVFPD's funding high in Apple Valley

article_summary:
Named Measure G, that tax would've extended the current tax funding from Nov. 4, 2017 to June 30, 2034.
Measure G needed a two-thirds majority vote to pass, but received just over 59 percent approval from about 9,000 voters served by the district.
With Measure G defeated and property tax revenue becoming a stagnant funding source that "isn't even enough to run a volunteer program," the extension of Measure V is a must for the district, according to Hultquist.
